title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<debajit> Hi. I notice that the Admin/admin user did not get created for me when I set up XWiki on a machine. How could I fix this? Alternatively if there is a wiki page that talks about this (I could not find one), please let me know.  
00:46 <Slashman> has quit  
00:49 <sorinello> has quit  
00:50 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
00:50 <sorinello> has quit  
00:56 <sorinello\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:56 <sorinello\_> has quit  
00:58 <sorinello\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:59 <sorinello> has quit  
01:23 <debajit> has quit  
03:49 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
04:09 <cpe> has quit  
04:09 <cpe> has joined #xwiki  
04:11 <Denis1> has quit  
06:57 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <sorinello\_> has quit  
08:27 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <Ramona1> has quit  
08:29 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <Ramona1> has quit  
08:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol> has quit  
09:10 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:11 <Denis> mflorea: Did you finally open a jira for the issue you had with the authorization manager with attachment references ?  
09:12 <vmassol1> good morning everyone  
09:12 <Denis> yes, good morning as well  
09:14 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:22 <mflorea> @Denis, no, I didn't  
09:22 <Denis> ok, I will  
09:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:16 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <vmassol> trying to fix toggleDrawer() which fails locally on my machine  
10:38 <vmassol> I've upgraded to FF 32.0.1 which is the version used on agents (I had version 20.x)  
10:39 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Ramona1> has quit  
10:43 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <Enygma`> Hi  
10:55 <Enygma`> does anybody plan to work on XWIKI-12552 for 7.2RC1 ?  
10:56 <vmassol> Enygma`: was created by Denis this morning. Denis, are you on it? Will you fix it before Monday?  
10:56 <Denis> I hope so, yes  
10:57 <Enygma`> does this issue currently block any particular feature? (I can`t determine that from the issue)  
11:02 <Denis> difficult to say, it is the issue Marius raised recently when he try checking access to an attachment  
11:22 <tmortagne> Denis: pretty sure mflorea worked around it but it should definitely be fixed for 7.2 final, It's not so much of a blocker for RC1 since it probably always been like this (i.e. not a regression)  
11:24 <tmortagne> (easy workaround being to extact document reference before calling the API)  
11:24 <tmortagne> s/extact/extract/  
11:25 <mflorea> tmortagne: I didn't need it in the end, but it would be nice to fix it, not necessarily for 7.2 though  
11:33 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:35 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <vmassol> FYI a user just told me he didn't understand why there's an Edit button in edit mode and that he clicked on it instead of save  
11:50 <vmassol> I remember we had that discussion but apparently we haven't implemented anytihng yet, do we have a jira issue?  
11:51 <vmassol> found it  
11:51 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12186  
11:52 <Enygma`> IMO a confirmation dialog that you are about to lose any unsaved data would be better  
11:52 <vmassol> yep  
11:52 <vmassol> I agree  
11:52 <Enygma`> there should be an issue for that as well  
11:53 <vmassol> (that was my comment on that issue)  
11:53 <vmassol> "Another idea discussed was about displaying a warning box when trying to move away when in edit mode and you've made changes that have not been saved (as jira is doing! ).  
11:53 <vmassol> If someone remembers the discussion thread, it would be nice to link it here."  
12:04 <Enygma`> that issues seems to have vanished from the face of the earth  
12:04 <Enygma`> can`t find it, though I know I had an attempt at it once  
12:07 <Enygma`> aha! http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6927  
12:11 <vmassol> ok so we have that issue + XWIKI-10464 too  
12:11 <vmassol> we'll need some discussion on the list to decide I guess  
12:11 <Enygma`> yes, too many issues on the same topic  
12:12 <Enygma`> needs attention  
12:12 <Enygma`> probably yhis too http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10061  
12:16 <Enygma`> vmassol: I guess for XWIKI-10061 you wanted to link XWIKI-6927 instead of XWIKI-12186  
12:16 <Enygma`> I just did that pretty much at the same time :)  
12:16 <vmassol> yes  
12:16 <vmassol> 6927 is my preference  
12:17 <Enygma`> removing the link to XWiki-12186  
12:17 <vmassol> why?  
12:17 <vmassol> it's related  
12:18 <vmassol> starting podcast recording  
12:18 <Enygma`> XWIKI-10061 talks about keyboard shortcuts... while XWIKI-12186 talks about the edit button that should become "save"... the only relation I see there is that they both talk about the "edit" action :)  
12:18 <Enygma`> anyway, I`ll let you remove it if you come to the same conclusion  
12:35 <Pbas> has left #xwiki  
12:35 <silverdrop> has quit  
12:36 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:13 <Denis> has quit  
13:40 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:46 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:01 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <vmassol> investigating why CreatePageAndSpaceTest is failing locally  
14:11 <tmortagne> mflorea: I'm looking at the failing EM test and there is something weird: the issue for most of them seems to be that the extension is directly uninstall without displaying an uninstall plan, if that rings a bell...  
14:12 <tmortagne> s/uninstall/uninstalled/  
14:12 <tmortagne> s/test/tests/  
14:16 <mflorea> tmortagne: when is this happening? In the test setup we cleanup by uninstalling all the used extensions, and this is done directly. But otherwise, the uninstall plan should be displayed  
14:31 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <vmassol> ok so it seems textInputElement.sendKeys(Keys.END) doesn't work anymore locally  
14:42 <vmassol> (on mac)  
14:47 <tmortagne> mflorea: I'm not talking about the setup  
14:47 <tmortagne> some test are explicitely uninstalling extension and check some stuff in the uninstall plan  
14:47 <tmortagne> see for example http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/1607/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testDowngrade/  
14:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <tmortagne> in that test it start an uninstall and then check a few things in the uninstall plan but it can't find them and in the screenshot we can see the uninstall is done  
14:49 <tmortagne> so it looks like it directly uninstalled instead od displaying the uninstall plan and waiting for someone clicking on continue  
14:49 <tmortagne> and it's the same issue in most of the failing test of not all (did not checked all of them)  
14:49 <tmortagne> did not tried locally yet  
14:50 <tmortagne> but yesterday everything was passing for me locally  
14:58 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:01 <tmortagne> mflorea: I don't have them locally so clearly it's a race condition somewhere that make the extension full uninstalled when the test expect the uninstall plan  
15:02 <vmassol> Enygma`: did you see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/ ?  
15:02 <tmortagne> probably not something new, just happening more often on jenkins it seems  
15:02 <tmortagne> for some reason  
15:04 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <vmassol> taking LinkCheckerTransformationTest  
15:11 <vmassol> (ci is down for me)  
15:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: works for me  
15:11 <vmassol> (gtg to the doctor in 5 minutes, should be back under 1 hour)  
15:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: does this work:  
15:11 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/org.xwiki.rendering$xwiki-rendering-transformation-linkchecker/398/testReport/org.xwiki.rendering.internal.transformation.linkchecker/LinkCheckerTransformationTest/transformWithAntiFloodKickingIn/claim/claim  
15:11 <vmassol> wait  
15:12 <vmassol> ok it works now  
15:12 <vmassol> when I clicked claim I got a fatal error  
15:12 <vmassol> but the claim was registered  
15:12 <vmassol> seems there's a bug in the claim plugin  
15:12 <tmortagne> yep I see you registred  
15:14 <tmortagne> I don't understand why http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/UsersGroupsRightsManagementTest/testCreateGroupWhenGroupAlreadyExists/ is still failing the message is right in the properties files (https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.propert  
15:15 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
15:15 <vmassol> gtg  
15:37 <Enygma`> the claim plugin NPE issue is already reported https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-26154  
15:38 <Enygma`> but it`s a minor inconvenience only  
15:40 <Enygma`> vmassol: will have a look at the failing copy tests in test-ui  
15:48 <tmortagne> I don't know where "{0} cannot be used for the group name, as another document with this name already exists." come from but it's not from https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties#L1891, I checking th file in the jar and I still get the wrong message at runtime  
15:50 <Enygma`> lol  
15:50 <Enygma`> tmortagne: xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/addnewgroup.vm  
15:50 <Enygma`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/addnewgroup.vm#L12  
15:51 <tmortagne> of course, I search in all .xml and .properties and not in .vm...  
15:51 <Enygma`> early optimisations... (in grep) :)  
15:51 <tmortagne> so it's not using the translation as it should  
15:53 <tmortagne> introduced in http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10850  
15:55 <tmortagne> gsmeria: can I let you take care of XWIKI-12553 ?  
15:56 <gsmeria> tmortagne: hello. yes  
15:56 <tmortagne> thanks  
15:57 <Enygma`> dropping http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.wysiwyg.test.ui/EditWYSIWYGTest/testUndoRepeatedPaste/  
15:57 <Enygma`> ... it really does not seem to be related to XWiki, but a test setup issue on either the agents or the firefox version (bug).  
15:58 <Slashman> has quit  
16:00 <tmortagne> we should probably upgrade the FF version in the agents by the way, it's starting to be old  
16:01 <Enygma`> I agree  
16:01 <Enygma`> though there is this https://code.google.com/p/selenium/source/browse/java/CHANGELOG  
16:01 <Enygma`>   provides. As such, fall back to synthesized events on recent Firefox  
16:01 <tmortagne> especially since we are supposed to support only the lastest FF version  
16:01 <Enygma`> I wonder if this will create issues  
16:02 <tmortagne> hmm indeed not a good news  
16:03 <Enygma`> here is a more recent changelog https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/dotnet/CHANGELOG  
16:03 <Enygma`> ah, scratch that  
16:04 <Enygma`> it`s for dotnet :)  
16:04 <Enygma`> this is for java https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/CHANGELOG

18:28 <vmassol> wow 19 failures more in platform  
18:28 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/  
18:29 <vmassol> seems some recent commits today caused a problem  
18:29 <vmassol> [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences%5D ERROR o.x.v.i.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Exception in macro #getHierarchyPath called at 12:xwiki:XWiki.AdminSheet[line 22, column 3]  
18:29 <vmassol> checking for a change in those macros  
18:29 <sorinello> has quit  
18:31 <vmassol> ok caused by marius commits  
18:31 <vmassol> in XWIKI-12176  
18:34 <vmassol> seems we failed to be ready for Monday  
18:34 <vmassol> we still have lots of failing tests  
18:35 <vmassol> and 3 open issues  
18:35 <vmassol> (2 are open for RC1 but not blocker IMO)  
18:35 <vmassol> I'm worried that marius still has 3 issues on his plate  
18:35 <vmassol> too bad he's not here to give us an ETA
